DOC.brief_summary: Objectives : To compare acute effect gamma delta rich tocotrienol fraction ( gd-TRF ) insulin sensitivity , metabolic risk marker postprandial lipemia individual risk metabolic syndrome . Hypothesis : Gamma delta-rich TRF improve insulin sensitivity , metabolic risk marker postprandial lipemia individual risk metabolic syndrome .
DOC.brief_title: Acute Effects Tocotrienols Insulin Sensitivity Metabolic Risk Markers Individuals Risk Metabolic Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: A randomised , double-blind , crossover trial undertaken test acute effect supplementation 200 mg , 400 mg gd-TRF vs. placebo . There 3 occasion subject attend postprandial period occasion separate least one week . On day precede postprandial high fat meal challenge , subject ask avoid food high fat , alcohol , caffeine take part strenuous exercise . Subjects provide standardised low fat meal ( contain < 10 g fat ) day precede postprandial study day consume even meal . They ask fast overnight instruct avoid eat drink anything , except water , 10 pm . Fasting blood sample collect next day subject consume test meal , contain 50 g test fat supplement gd-TRF . Further venous blood sample collect regular interval 6 hour postprandially .
DOC.criteria: Age : 2060 year BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 Elevated triacylglycerols ≥ 1.70 mmol/L Low HDL cholesterol < 1.04 mmol/L ( men ) , < 1.30 mmol/L ( woman ) Elevated blood pressure ≥ 130/ ≥ 85 mmHg Fasting plasma glucose ≥ 5.60 7.00 mmol/L Increased waist circumference ≥ 90 cm ( men ) , ≥ 80 cm ( woman ) BMI ≤ 18.5 kg/m2 Current use antihypertensive lipid lowering , insulin/glucose modulate medication Lactose/milk intolerance Alcohol intake exceed moderate intake ( > 28 unit per week ) Smoker Pregnancy lactation Fever , cold infection bleeding day
